UAObjectType.Description: Last known calibration report - if any.

UAObject.Description: FunctionalUnitState provides the state-machine of the FunctionalUnit.
The FunctionSetType is used for organising FunctionType objects in an unordered list structure.
The ProgramManager provides the functional unit's program manager.

The ActiveProgram specifies the current state of operation of a FunctionalUnit. It provides context and information about the currently active program on the device. This allows users to follow the progress of a program run in a standardized fashion by organising steps into a flat, linear sequence.

UAVariable.Description: CurrentRuntime is the current run-time of the program -run. The CurrentRunTime is set to 0 at the start of the program and is counted upwards as long as the program run is not in a Paused state. The Paused state is an aggregation of the Suspended state and the Held state.
EstimatedRuntime is the estimated run-time of the current program run. If the runtime cannot be estimated, the StatusCode BadNoData should be sent.

DeviceProgramRunId represents a device-specific unique internal identifier for this program run. Its value shall be identical to the return value of the last call to the FunctionalUnit’s StartProgram() Method. It is used to identify the result object corresponding to this program run within the FunctionalUnit’s result set.
Boolean sensor value.
Human readable identifier of the signals' false state.
Human readable identifier of the signals' true state.
Discrete sensor value.
List of human readable identifiers for the discrete sensor values.
AssetId is a user writable alphanumeric character sequence uniquely identifying a component. The ID is provided by the integrator or user of the device.
ComponentName is a user writable name provided by the integrator or user of the component.

UAObject.Description: DeviceState represents the Device’s state of operation. It is inspired by the AnalyserDeviceStateMachineType from the Analyzer Devices Specification.

UAVariable.Description: Revision level of the hardware of the device

UAObject.Description: Identification provides properties to identify a device or component.
MachineryItemState indicates the current state of the device in conformance with the Machinery Basics specification.
State machine representing the operation mode of a laboratory device. Optional methods allow for initiating changes of the operation mode from remote.

UAVariable.Description: Name of the company that manufactured the device
Model name of the device
Identifier that uniquely identifies, within a manufacturer, a device instance
Revision level of the software/firmware of the device

UAObject.Description: The FunctionalUnitSetType provides a set of a FunctionalUnit objects.

UAVariable.Description: Shortcut to start the "Register Weight" program-template with defualt values.

UAObject.Description: The ResultSetType is used for organising ResultType objects in an unordered list structure.

UAVariable.Description: NodeVersion and the GeneralModelChangeEventType are mechanisms to notify clients that the content of the set has changed and shall be used as defined in OPC 10000-3.

UAMethod.Description: Shortcut to start the "Set Tare" program-template.

UAVariable.Description: the definition of the input argument of method 4:FunctionalUnitState.34:SetTare
the definition of the output arguments of method 4:FunctionalUnitState.34:SetTare

UAMethod.Description: Shortcut to start the "Set Zero" program-template.

UAVariable.Description: the definition of the input argument of method 4:FunctionalUnitState.34:StartZero
the definition of the output arguments of method 4:FunctionalUnitState.34:StartZero
the definition of the input argument of method 4:FunctionalUnitState.34:RegisterWeight
the definition of the output arguments of method 4:FunctionalUnitState.34:RegisterWeight
IsEnabled indicates whether the Function can currently be executed on the Device. A Function may be disabled for several reasons including not licensed, missing hardware modules, or missing supplies
IsEnabled indicates whether the Function can currently be executed on the Device. A Function may be disabled for several reasons including not licensed, missing hardware modules, or missing supplies

To be used by end users to store the location of the machine in a scheme specific to the end user. Servers shall support at least 60 Unicode characters for the clients writing this value, this means clients can expect to be able to write strings with a length of 60 Unicode characters into that field.

SensorValue is the calibrated and optionally compensated/filtered process value.

SensorValue is the calibrated and optionally compensated/filtered process value.

the definition of the output arguments of method 4:FunctionalUnitState.34:ClearTare

the definition of the output arguments of method 4:FunctionalUnitState.34:SetPresetTare
